titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ye Old College Inn memorabilia, 1915-ca.1960 MS 526
titlestmt.author: Suellen Denton

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Ye Old College Inn memorabilia collection
did.abstract: This collection contains memorabilia from the Ye Old College Inn. It consists of photographs, a recipe book and a scrapbook from the Ye Old College Inn. The photographs are those taken of Rice college teams and athletes as early as 1915 and they include baseball, basketball, cross-country, football, and track athletes. The recipe book was put together by Ernie Coker who was one of the owners of the Ye Old College Inn. The scrapbook contains photos and news articles pertaining to Owl athletes and their achievements.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: George Martin established a restaurant across from the Rice playing fields in 1918 which originated as a small eatery. It soon became a hangout for Rice University athletes and became known as the Ye Old College Inn by 1921. In 1946, Martin turned the restaurant over to Ernie Coker who added the Varsity Room to it in the early fifties. The Varsity Room served as a banquet hall for meetings, sports banquets, and dances. Photographs of Owl athletes hung on the walls of the Ye Old College Inn until the restaurant closed its doors. The photographs and other memorabilia were then handed over to the Rice Athletic Department.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains memorabilia from the Ye Old College Inn. It consists of photographs, a recipe book and a scrapbook from the Ye Old College Inn. The photographs are those taken of Rice college teams and athletes as early as 1915 and they include baseball, basketball, cross-country, football, and track athletes. The recipe book was put together by Ernie Coker who was one of the owners of the Ye Old College Inn. The scrapbook contains photos and news articles pertaining to Owl athletes and their achievements.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred from the Rice Athletic Department in 2008. Menu, children's menu, match book, postcard, newsclips donated by David Bynog, Jan. 2018.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Portions of this collection are available online at: https://scholarship.rice.edu/handle/1911/21893" title="Ye Old College Inn memorabilia">https://scholarship.rice.edu/handle/1911/21893

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ye Old College Inn memorabilia , 1915-ca.1960, MS 526, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Ye Old College Inn memorabilia , 1915-ca.1960 must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

did.unittitle: Baseball Photographs, 1922-1924. Three team posed photographs of the Owl baseball team
Basketball Photographs, 1915, 1919?, 1924, and 1953-54. Four team photos and an individual photograph of Owl athlete Tony Bell in uniform

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs that are not dated but estimated as taken in the late 1910's, early 1920's. Candid photos of football games against Southern Methodist University and team practices. Photograph of Tony Bell securing the first touchdown ever made against University of Texas, Oct. 17, 1917. Photograph of Owl athletes on the line practicing: Tony Bell, Fred Boetcher, Hal Heath, Eddie Dyer, Van Brown, Bo Pollard, Giant Duggan, Emmett McFarland, Lee Vilbig, Miller Alexander, and Ed Deprato, 1918. Posed photographs of Frank Gerlach, Eddie Dyer, Tony Bell, Fred Boetcher, Red Tatum, Nepos Harlan, Emmett McFarland, Miller Alexander, Geo Powell, Ed Deprato, and "Heavy" Underwood, circa 1918.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Gerald Weatherly and "Froggy" Williams, John Crow, Charley Malmberg and Weldon Humble (1946), Kozze Johnson, Bill Howton, Dickie Morgle, Don Rhoden.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains posed team photographs of Owl football teams. There are two team photographs taken in 1915, three in 1916, three in 1917 and two in 1918.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains posed team photographs Owl football teams. There is one team photograph taken in 1921, are two in 1922, and three in 1923.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains posed team photographs of Owl football teams. There are two taken in 1924, one photograph of the 1925 Varsity Team, one photograph of the 1926 and 1929 teams, and one of each of the 1950-1954 and 1957 teams.

did.unittitle: Individual and Group Photographs of coaches and athletes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These include a photograph of Jim Thorpe given to George Martin in 1933, Frank Goss and Preacher Lindsey (date unknown), a group photograph with Jess Neeley and Bill Wallace, the rest of the photographs are of unidentified.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Rice coaches of football, baseball and track

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs include group photographs of all the Rice athletic coaches of 1923, football coaches circa 1930's, the Southwest Conference Representatives which includes Jess Neely, and The Rice Institute Athletic Coaching Staff circa 1950's. Individual photographs include those of Coach John Nicholson (date unknown), and Coach Ernie Hjertberg with athlete Fred Stancliff (date unknown). Two photographs of coaches signing the "Coaches Table" of the Ye Old College Inn, circa 1950's. The rest of the photographs are unnamed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs contain posed team photographs in 1915, 1919, 1922, 1924, 1926, 1929 and not dated. There are also candid photographs of team practices, one photograph of Jack Pollard and Howard Eiser, and a signed photograph of Fred Wolcott.

did.unittitle: Series II: Ernie Coker Recipe Book, 1959
A small book of recipes put together by Ernie Coker from his collection in 1959 to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the Ye Old College Inn
A large wooden bound scrapbook dated from 1921 containing photographs and news articles of Rice University athletes, coaches, and special events dating through the 1950's
Menu, children's menu, match book, postcard, newclips
